revised_title: Analytic Theory for the Selection of Saffman-Taylor Fingers with Thin Film Effects
tldr: The article presents an analytic theory for the selection of Saffman-Taylor fingers in the presence of thin film effects. The theory focuses on small capillary number and small gap-to-width ratio, and it shows that fingers with relative width are possible. The study also discusses the discrepancies between the theoretical predictions and experimental results, suggesting that thin film effects play a significant role in the fingering problem.
